definition: jade-like stone/clean and white/tinkling of pendants
see 瑯琊山|琅玡山[Lang2 ya2 Shan1]

sentences.chinese: 白色颜色真正珐琅拨号盘。

sentences.english: His left hand, which rested on his enamelled sword hilt, was bandaged.
sentences.chinese: 他那按在宝剑珐琅柄上的左手外面裹着绷带。

sentences.english: Glass - body painted enamel is a handicraft originated in China.
sentences.chinese: 玻璃胎画珐琅为我国首创的工艺品种。

sentences.english: The acids corrode the enamel of the teeth.
sentences.chinese: 这些酸腐蚀牙齿的珐琅质。

sentences.english: Great White Dental Lab in Lodi fashions enamel teeth called" crowns" .
sentences.chinese: 罗带的大白牙实验室制作名为“皇冠”的珐琅牙。

sentences.english: My part that protrudes from the gum has a "skin" of enamel .
sentences.chinese: 在我突出于齿龈的部分有一层珐琅“皮”。

sentences.english: Guardian of a vampire's nest; dragonencapsulated in a polished black enamel.
sentences.chinese: 吸血鬼巢穴的守护者，黑色珐琅烤漆龙纹。

sentences.english: The outer jacketing shall have a backed enamel finish.
sentences.chinese: 热水器外壳应该使珐琅釉面。

sentences.english: Outer layer of the tooth enamel and ivory to protect the pulp quality.
sentences.chinese: 牙齿的外层有珐琅质及象牙质来保护牙髓。

sentences.english: The jacket shall be round 16-gauge galvanized steel with acrylic enamel finish.
sentences.chinese: 外壳应该是圆形16级电镀钢，外覆亚克力珐琅表面。

sentences.english: These three techniques of enamel have their own advantages and learn from each other.
sentences.chinese: 这三种珐琅工艺相互借鉴，各有千秋。

sentences.english: In the presence of sugars or starches, the bacteria produce an acid that attacks the tooth enamel.
sentences.chinese: 在糖或淀粉的存在，细菌产生的酸，攻击牙齿珐琅质。

sentences.english: Most of the Canton enamels used the famille rose colors peculiar to Europe.
sentences.chinese: 广东大多数画珐琅用的是欧洲的粉彩。

sentences.english: Qing court enamel painted porcelain created a new breed for Ming Qing painted porcelain.
sentences.chinese: 清宫珐琅彩瓷创造了彩瓷的新品种。

sentences.english: I chipped the enamel on my front tooth when I fell over.
sentences.chinese: 我跌倒时门牙的珐琅质碰碎了。

sentences.english: In more severe cases, all the enamel may be damaged.
sentences.chinese: 较为严重者，所有珐琅都可能受到损害。

definition: bone china (fine white porcelain made from a mixture of clay and bone ash)
variant of 鎦金|镏金[liu2 jin1]
variant of 表盤|表盘[biao3 pan2]/watch face
